comment:
Nose is oak, vanilla, bit of caramel and spice. Classic bourbon here.

Taste is warm, oak, grass, cinnamon spice, and a hint of sweetness.

Finish has a bit of heat for 90 proof with oak and spice notes.

Young but with a pleasant mouth feel.  I can’t get over the finish.  It’s like eating red hot candies after you swallowed them.  For under 20 bucks it’s way more drinkable than most in this range. Cheers
Spicy. Cinnamon. Not a long finish. But delightful for price range.
smells like alcohol with a hint of sweetness. The taste is Bourbon nothing offensive nothing complex. Smooth finish with a few sweet notes. probably be best as a mixer
Easy to drink, pleasant flavor, basic whiskey
Tastes extremely young. To me it tasted really spicy and of raw corn.
Looks like the kind of whisky bottle I’d imagine finding on an end-cap at Target next to some yellow tail moscato. Ha! Passs...
pretty basic. light and sweet easy to drink
It’s like spearmint gum meets vanilla tic tacs and brown sugar with a dabble of cinnamon throughout
Nice sipper, tastes like a blend of 1792 and Larceny. Not too much heat, medium finish. I enjoyed it.
